alert.note: Alert for Nez Perce (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 9:10PM MDT until June 13 at 12:15AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Bedrock Burn Scar in... Northeastern Nez Perce County in north central Idaho... * Until 1115 PM PDT. * At 810 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated very heavy rain over the Bedrock Burn Scar. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Bedrock burn scar. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by very heavy rain in and around the Bedrock Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Bedrock Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lenore. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: The affected areas are in and below the Bedrock burn scar north of Lenore, including parts of Bedrock Road and River Road. Some drainage basins impacted include Bedrock Creek, Louse Creek and Pine Creek. High intensity rainfall on the burned area may cause flash flooding, mud slides and rock slides. Hikers, residents, and motorists in and below the Bedrock burned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
